page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY OF PROBUS
page.content: {General Survey of Probus Area} This area has one main settlement, which is the village of Probus between Truro & St.Austell.Most of the remainder is mixed farmland with scattered farmhouses.The countryside has undulating hills & valleys,often with woodland in the latter.There is one large estate,Trewithen,with a house & gardens open to public.Also open to the public are the Demonstration Gardens,probably unique in Europe.There 2 main roads,the A3078 to St.Mawes & the A390,one of the main trunk roads through Cornwall.These are connected by a maze of narrow lanes, usually with high hedges,thick with wild flowers in June.Apart from the traffic on the main roads,much of the area seems remote & untouched by the tourist trade.
